snippet: A violent crackdown on protesters in the country’s largest city could complicate matters for President Bashar al-Assad, who has deftly maneuvered to stay in power throughout the uprising.
abstract: Syrian forces fire on mass demonstrators in Aleppo, country's largest city, where thousands of people massed to demonstrate against the violent closing of Aleppo University day earlier; at least four demonstrators are said to be killed.
lead_paragraph: A violent crackdown on protesters in the country’s largest city could complicate matters for President Bashar al-Assad, who has deftly maneuvered to stay in power throughout the uprising.

headline.seo: Aleppo Clash Poses Risk of Widening Syrian Revolt

headline.print_headline: Aleppo Clash Poses Risk Of Widening Syrian Revolt
